unit_learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate a refined awareness of language and language use, in both Italian and in English.
Apply relevant language conventions to create meaningful intercultural encounters.
Develop intermediate level skills in reading, writing, listening and speaking in the Italian language.
Identify, evaluate and deploy the grammatical structures of Italian at intermediate level.
Identify, describe and evaluate many aspects of Italian-speaking cultures and societies.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Students are expected to spend time on daily review of grammar and vocabulary, and Italian practice. Students should be familiar with the content of a week before attending their following seminar and feel comfortable with each week's content before starting a new week.

assessments.description: Students will listen to an audio recording and then answer a series of comprehension questions. External students will complete online.
Weekly activities to check and confirm active engagement with course material. This includes online forum discussions.

Students are required to prepare and perform a role play in Italian and record it on a video file. Students will complete this task online via synchronous and/or asynchronous activities. See iLearn for more information.
Final exam covering all material studied in second semester.

data.description: This unit is designed to further develop skills in all areas of Italian language (reading, writing, listening and speaking) to a higher level of proficiency. Students learn to discuss a wider range of topics as well as substantially increase their knowledge of vocabulary as well as increasing students' skills in intercultural communication so that they will be able to communicate in a manner which is culturally as well as linguistically appropriate.
